description: Charles Hoyt Allred Sr., 80, of Crossville, passed away Monday, June 1, 2020, at Cumberland Medical Center. He was born Dec. 17, 1939, in Clarkrange, son of the late Virgil Allred and Emma E. Todd Allred. He is survived by his wife, Bonnie Allred of Crossville; son, Charles Hoyt Allred Jr. of Crossville; daughter, Ellen Allred of Crossville; grandchildren, Patric Allred of...
text:
Charles Hoyt Allred Sr., 80, of Crossville, passed away Monday, June 1, 2020,
at Cumberland Medical Center.

He was born Dec. 17, 1939, in Clarkrange, son of the late Virgil Allred and
Emma E. Todd Allred.

He proudly served his county in the United States Army, retiring with almost
30 years of service. He was also a member of Tollett's Chapel Methodist
Church.

He is survived by his wife, Bonnie Allred of Crossville; son, Charles Hoyt
Allred Jr. (Michele) of Crossville; daughter, Ellen Allred of Crossville;
grandchildren, Patric Allred (Courtney) of Crossville, Alyson McNulty of
Athens and Ashlyn McNulty of Fort Jackson SC; great-granddaughter, Allie Grace
Allred; great-grandson on the way, Brady Hoyt Allred; and brothers, Bernerd
Allred of Cookeville and Howard Allred (Jo) of Jamestown.

In addition to his parents, Charles is preceded in death by his brothers,
James Allred and Bob Allred; and sister, Willodean Rose.

Funeral services were held at Bilbrey Funeral Home on Sunday, June 7, at 3
p.m. with Bro. Ronald Dyer officiating. Interment in Clarkrange Methodist
Church Cemetery.

title: Charles Hoyt Allred, Sr.
html:
Charles Hoyt Allred Sr., 80, of Crossville, passed away Monday, June 1, 2020, at Cumberland Medical Center.

He was born Dec. 17, 1939, in Clarkrange, son of the late Virgil Allred and Emma E. Todd Allred.

He proudly served his county in the United States Army, retiring with almost 30 years of service. He was also a member of Tollett's Chapel Methodist Church.

He is survived by his wife, Bonnie Allred of Crossville; son, Charles Hoyt Allred Jr. (Michele) of Crossville; daughter, Ellen Allred of Crossville; grandchildren, Patric Allred (Courtney) of Crossville, Alyson McNulty of Athens and Ashlyn McNulty of Fort Jackson SC; great-granddaughter, Allie Grace Allred; great-grandson on the way, Brady Hoyt Allred; and brothers, Bernerd Allred of Cookeville and Howard Allred (Jo) of Jamestown.

In addition to his parents, Charles is preceded in death by his brothers, James Allred and Bob Allred; and sister, Willodean Rose.

Funeral services were held at Bilbrey Funeral Home on Sunday, June 7, at 3 p.m. with Bro. Ronald Dyer officiating. Interment in Clarkrange Methodist Church Cemetery.
